page.title: 04SOME OF CRANTOCK'S HISTORY
page.content: A{Barrow}lies on the end of Pentire Head. A Barrow is a burial place for an important Bronze Age Person. There has been a settlement and church in Crantock for over 1200 years. It grew as a fishing port and boat repair centre but the estuary has sanded up in recent years. The village has grown with retired people.Our retirement ages at present are 65 for men and 60 for women. West Pentire has evidence of{early settlement.}The Bowgie Pub in Cornish means cow shelter. Treago farm is mentioned in the 1086 Domesday Book. Kelsey Head has the remains of a{cliff castle}at least 300 years old. Robert described it as a big place with a wooden fence and a stone wall, each with a gateway. The 2 gates were never in line in order to make entry difficult
